title: NOAA releases revised winter weather outlook for New England
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Weather The revised outlook predicts general temperatures and precipitation levels for December through February.
Craig F.
Walker / The Boston Globe, File The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration released a revised winter weather outlook for New England on Thursday.

title: Scratch ticket bought at Mass. gas station yields $4M prize
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Local News There is still one grand prize remaining on the "100X" instant ticket game.
The Candy 2025 Trust of Lowell, represented by Nikki Caplis, won $4 million on a "100X" instant ticket game.

title: Bus carrying UMass Lowell students catches fire
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Local News The students and band equipment were evacuated safely.
The bus carrying UMass Lowell students that caught on fire.
Westwood Fire Department A bus carrying the UMass Lowell marching band caught fire on Sunday.

title: Young girl dies after head-on crash in Taunton
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News A 25-year-old mother and her two girls were brought to local hospitals after a crash on Broadway in Taunton.
The youngest girl did not survive.
A young child died after being involved in a head-on car crash in Taunton Saturday night.

title: Lawyers for Civil Rights calls for probe into Everett police over teen’s ICE arrest
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Local News The Boston-based organization said the “alarming sequence of events” raises questions about whether local police coordinated with ICE.
Demonstrators protest during a rally outside Everett City Hall after a 13-year-old boy was arrested by Immigration and Customs Enforcement agents following an interaction with local police.

Barry Chin/Boston Globe Staff By Abby Patkin October 20, 2025 | 10:57 AM 2 minutes to read A Boston-based civil rights organization is calling for a state probe into Everett police following the controversial arrest of a 13-year-old boy who was later detained by federal immigration officials.

title: SWAT team arrests 2 teens after woman shot in Hyannis, police say
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Crime Police say the teens will be arraigned Monday in Barnstable District Court.
Evan Araujo, left, and Jacob Winbush are being arraigned in Barnstable District Court on Monday for allegedly shooting a 28-year-old woman in Hyannis on Saturday.
Courtesy of the Barnstable Police Department Barnstable police arrested two teenagers on Saturday for allegedly shooting a 28-year-old woman in the chest in Hyannis.

title: Another Boston Lululemon store was hit by shoplifters
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Crime The two female suspects reportedly stole about $700 worth of merchandise.
The suspects.

title: Mike Vrabel on returning to Tennessee, Patriots running back usage, and authenticity with players
